Faculty is one of Europe’s leading applied artificial intelligence companies. We build, deploy and operate AI solutions to increase our customers’ performance and help them realise their full potential. We believe that AI should be trustworthy, impactful and beneficial across society. Those principles have shaped our work with more than 230 organisations across the public and private sectors as we help them use AI to understand more deeply, make better decisions and act faster.

To give an example, during the COVID-19 pandemic, we built the COVID-19 Early Warning System to forecast hospital admissions and life-saving equipment up to three weeks in advance. The ground-breaking tool helped frontline workers at the NHS save lives. We also work with the Home Office on Counter-Terrorism initiatives - Faculty built an AI model that automatically detects both new and existing propaganda videos and stops them from being uploaded.

Please note that due to the nature of our current project requirements, applicants must either hold valid existing security clearance, or be eligible for UK security clearance (5 years continuous UK address history, no criminal convictions). Faculty will cover in full any costs associated.

What you'll be doing

The Machine Learning Engineering team is responsible for the engineering aspects of our client delivery projects. As a Senior

Machine Learning Engineer, you’ll be essential to helping us achieve that goal by:

Designing and building software and infrastructure to support Machine Learning applications;
Leading engineering interactions with our clients;
Mentoring data scientists and engineers in best practices and new technologies;
Creating reusable, scalable tools to enable better delivery of ML systems; and
Implementing and developing Faculty’s view on what it means to operationalise ML software.
You will support both technical and non-technical stakeholders to deploy ML to solve real-world problems. To enable this, we work in cross functional teams with representation from commercial and data science specialities to cover all aspects of AI product delivery.


We’re a rapidly growing organisation, so roles are dynamic and subject to change. Your role will evolve alongside business needs, but you can expect your key responsibilities to include:

Scoping projects
Providing technical support during Business Development
Managing and Mentoring technical staff
Technical Delivery


Requirements

Who We're Looking For

At Faculty, your attitude and behaviour are just as important as your technical skill. We look for individuals who can support our values, foster our culture, and deliver for our organisation.

We like people who combine expertise and ambition with optimism -- who are interested in changing the world for the better -- and have the drive and intelligence to make it happen. If you’re the right candidate for us, you probably:

Think scientifically, even if you’re not a scientist - you test assumptions, seek evidence and are always looking for opportunities to improve the way we do things.
Love finding new ways to solve old problems - when it comes to your work and your professional development, you don’t believe in ‘good enough’. You always seek new ways to solve old challenges.
Are pragmatic and outcome-focused - you know how to balance the big picture with the little details and know a great idea is useless if it can’t be executed in the real world.
Excellent communication skills;
Experience in working directly with clients and end users;
Requirements gathering;
Technical planning and scoping;
User acceptance testing;
A drive to learn new technologies and novel applications of existing technologies;
Experience in leading technical delivery; and
Technical mentoring


To succeed in this role, you’ll need demonstrable in the following:

Software Engineering in Python
Linux system management
Docker/Containerisation
CI/CD Technologies
Automated testing
AWS, GCP or Azure experience
Systems design and maintenance


Benefits

What we can offer you

The Faculty team is diverse and distinctive, and we all come from different personal, professional and organisational backgrounds. We all have one thing in common: we are driven by a deep intellectual curiosity that powers us forward each day. This curiosity pushes us to seek truth and understanding in everything we do, to execute work in a nimble and pragmatic manner, to foster talent in one another and always to challenge assumptions.

Faculty is the professional challenge of a lifetime. You’ll be surrounded by an impressive group of brilliant minds working to advance our goal of making artificial intelligence real. Our consultants, product developers, business development specialists, operations professionals and more all bring something unique to Faculty, and you’ll learn something new from everyone you meet. You’ll also have the opportunity to make your mark on a high-growth start-up now poised to expand internationally.

Fostering talent is one of our core values, it’s built into our culture and what we offer. Faculty was founded by people who are passionate about continuous learning, and adding value to our people.

Some of our benefits…..

Genuinely flexible working: We believe people have needs, responsibilities and interests that require something different to a strict working day. We trust people to organise and take accountability for their own work and do our best to support their lives outside Faculty. We provide you with all you need to work from home, including a laptop, keyboard, chair…even Sony headphones!
Equity, we want you to benefit from Faculty’s growth and success.
Unlimited holidays: We encourage each other to use this time to take a break, work on personal projects, or to spend time with their friends and family.
Fantastic private health, optical and dental cover, for you & your family - including 24/7 unlimited virtual private GP appointments and covering pre-existing medical conditions.
Access to mental health coaching with Sanctus
Breakfast & Lunch daily, and more fruit, drinks and snacks than you could ever eat (for office-based employees).
We work hard and make sure we enjoy what we do. So we have frequent socials and informal get-togethers to help make sure you enjoy your time with us. You’ll make friends and professional connections that will last a lifetime.

About Modular

We believe that AI is a net positive force in the world. Our vision and mission are to help rebuild AI infrastructure to advance humanity and our environment. We will do whatever it takes to empower our customers, team, and company to benefit from that pursuit. You can read about our culture and careers here to understand how we work and what we value.

We are owners and advocates for the underlying technologies, developer platforms, product components, and infrastructure. These essential building blocks form the high-quality and coherent experiences our users expect. We aim to drive the pace of innovation for every AI/ML developer.

About the role:

Modular is building a next-generation AI infrastructure platform that connects the many application frameworks and hardware backends, simplifying deployment for AI production teams and accelerating innovation for AI researchers and hardware developers. We are looking for someone to bridge the knowledge gap between Modular's development and product teams and our customer base and community. This involves creating user guides, writing blog posts, giving talks at conferences, leading workshops, and creating additional educational material. In this role, you will play a key role in building relationships and promoting the company's products with our customers. Join our world-leading product team and redefine how AI infrastructure is built and deployed.

LOCATION: This role is based out of North America. You can work out of one of our offices in Palo Alto, CA or Seattle, WA, or remotely from home.

What you will do:

Collaborate with engineering and product to develop high-quality, easy-to-understand tutorials to enable our users to build a strong mental model of our system and quickly start leveraging our products.
Write blog posts and create other educational content to educate future and current customers about the why and what of Modular products.
Give talks at conferences and other events to promote the company's products to the larger developer community.
Engage with our customer base through various channels, such as social media, forums, and online communities.
Work closely with the development and product teams to provide feedback on Modular's products from a customer perspective.
Respond to questions and provide support to customers of Modular products, including some of the world's largest corporations.
Participate in the Modular's larger developer relations, product, and marketing strategies.


What you bring to the table:

5+ years developer relations, or experience as a former software/AI developer.
Past experience working on AI infrastructure products and platforms like TensorFlow, PyTorch, TensorRT, CUDA, Triton Inference Server, VertexAI, Sagemaker.
Experience writing high-quality tutorials, product documentation, blog posts, and other documents targeted for a highly technical audience.
Experience engaging with the developer community through various channels, such video platforms and online communities.
Experience giving talks at conferences and other events.
Strong programming skills, including experience with python and C++.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to explain complex concepts in simple language.
A passion for staying up to date with industry trends and happenings.
A growth and leadership mindset, with an attitude that seeks to learn more from our customers, team, and the broader market.


Helpful experience (not required):

Master's degree or Ph.D. in Computer Science or related technical field.
Developed, trained, and/or deployed machine learning models into production environments.
Have worked in or around startups before or have a strong understanding of the nature of fast-moving, highly dynamic teams.


What Modular brings to the table:

Amazing Team. We are a progressive and agile team with some of the industry's best engineering and product leaders.
Flexible Location. We want you to work where you are most productive and we are a remote-first company. We have offices in Palo Alto, CA and Seattle, WA for collaboration, and will open more next year.
World-class Benefits. In order to attract the best, we need to offer the best. Premier insurance plans, up to 5% 401k matching, very generous WFH setup stipends, flexible paid time off, and more are available to you! Please note that specific benefit packages may vary based on your location.
Competitive Compensation. We offer very strong compensation packages, including stock options. We want people to be focused on their best work and believe in tailoring compensation plans to meet the needs of our workforce.
Team Building Events. We organize regular team onsites and local meetups in different cities.


Working at Modular will enable you to grow quickly as you work alongside incredibly motivated and talented people who have high standards, possess a growth mindset, and a purpose to truly change the world.

Modular is proud to emphasize an equal opportunity, safe environment for people to do their best work. Modular is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. If E-Verify cannot confirm that you are authorized to work, this employer is required to give you written instructions and an opportunity to contact Department of Homeland Security (DHS) or Social Security Administration (SSA) so you can begin to resolve the issue before the employer can take any action against you, including terminating your employment. Employers can only use E-Verify once you have accepted a job offer and completed the Form I-9.

About The Role

At FINESSE, we pride ourselves in building the foundations of a consumer brain - one that understands consumer preferences and predicts trends. As our Machine Learning Engineer, you will creatively brainstorm new data sources, pipelines and algorithmic strategies to improve our trend prediction and demand forecasting. You will work alongside brilliant members of a world class team to build fascinating technology and you will leverage the latest techniques in AI and machine learning across network analysis, natural language understanding, time series analysis, computer vision and recommendation systems to optimize our decisions on what to design, how much of it to produce, and which rising social media influencers to work with.

About You

You can’t wait to apply your data and machine learning expertise to figure out what’s trending in culture and fashion in realtime and to eliminate the inefficiencies in fashion design and distribution that contribute to fashion being the second largest polluter in the world. You love social data and the messy nature of it and embrace the challenges of big data, performance and scalability, thinking for the long-term and setting up systems that benchmark progress, prevent regressions, and are easily maintainable by other collaborators. Above all, you’re excited to build something from the ground up that will touch the lives of millions of people worldwide.

Recommended Background

Experience working with heavily alternative data sets
Experience across NLP, sentiment analysis, network/graph analysis, time series analysis, reinforcement learning, computer vision with a deep specialization in one area
Solid statistical foundation and inspired creative mathematical understanding of real world problems
Experience building production-level machine learning systems
Knowledge of technologies such as Tensorflow, Keras, Hadoop, Postgres, AWS, Docker

What You’ll Love At FINESSE

Being at the forefront of and working towards creating a culture-defining new product
A close-knit, extremely passionate & world class team excited about changing the face of fashion
A diverse team and culture that values inclusivity and individuality as highest priority
Company sponsored happy hours and outings
Comprehensive benefits: Medical, dental and vision insurance; 401k
Paid maternity and paternity leave
Sponsored weekly team lunches
Unlimited PTO

Our Culture

FINESSE has a dreamer & doer culture. We envision the next age of fashion & consumer and then get to work to implement it, always thinking creatively, innovatively and collaboratively to create real change. We are energetic, highly creative and hungry for change that is both revolutionizing as well as ethical.

At Birds.ai, we turn visual inspections into Insights for customers to manage their assets and infrastructure in a sustainable way. To achieve that, we automatically analyze images of visual inspections to identify objects, anomalies, and defects using our in-house developed platform. We are looking for a Software Engineer with AI experience to build software that does this fully automatically. More specifically, we develop web platforms to automatically review visual inspections and transform the results into insightful dashboards.




We are a small team and thus your work will have a huge impact on the technology we use and build to provide customers with valuable solutions! Some of the challenges we work on:




Counting the number of bottles on packaging lines.
Estimating the quality of steel flatness.
Predicting the lifetime of strawberries.




The Birds.ai team is at our office for at least two days in The Hague Tech (Den Haag). For this position you can expect a monthly gross remuneration of € 4.500 - € 5.000 based on full-time employment (40 hours).




Your Mission:




Build on both the front- and backend of our web platforms that provide customers with a birds-eye view of their assets and infrastructure.
Create reports and visualizations using information extracted from data.
Maintain, improve and (when necessary) scale up our infrastructure's capabilities.
Use Artificial Intelligence to find objects, anomalies and defects in images.

We are looking for an experienced NLP Engineer to join our dev team. NLP Engineer responsibilities include transforming natural language data into useful features using NLP techniques to feed classification, information extraction algorithms. To succeed in this role, you should possess outstanding skills in statistical analysis, machine learning methods and text representation techniques.




Responsibilities




Conceive, design and build NLP applications.
Work closely with the CTO to identify new research avenues, improving existing systems, identifying the right tooling and frameworks.
Work on research problems in information extraction, search and language processing.
Turn research and prototypes into production systems collaborating with backend and infrastructure engineers.
Remain updated in the rapidly changing field of machine learning and NLP.
Extend ML libraries and frameworks to apply in NLP tasks.
Perform statistical analysis of results and refine models.




Requirements




2 to 5 years' experience as an NLP engineer or similar role.
Understanding of NLP techniques for text representation, semantic extraction techniques, data structures and modelling.
Experience with machine learning frameworks (like Keras or PyTorch) and libraries (like scikitlearn).
Proficient knowledge of programming in Python.
Strong communication skills.
An analytical mind with problem-solving abilities.
Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science
Industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Technology, Information and Internet

Avalor AI

are young entrepreneurs with backgrounds in the military, computational science, systems & control, econometrics, software engineering and game development.
specialize in either AI, software integration or simulation, but actively contribute to any challenge that requires a team effort.

active guidance during the internship period
opportunity to apply state-of-the-art models to real world problems
an office in Amsterdam oost, close to the city centre (Oostenburg)
informal / collaborative environment

pursuing Msc. or obtained Msc. (e.g. AI, Computational Science, Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics or other relevant field)
curiosity and willingness to explore and deal with difficult topics
fluent in Python.

availability for 16+ hours a week (at least partially on-site).

experience using one of Pytorch, Keras, Tensorflow.

experience building data pipelines

Absci is the drug and target discovery company harnessing deep learning and synthetic biology to expand the therapeutic potential of proteins. We built our Integrated Drug Creation™ Platform to identify novel drug targets, discover optimal biotherapeutic candidates, and generate the cell lines to manufacture them in a single efficient process. Our goal is to enable the development of better medicines. We Translate Ideas into Drugs™. Based in Vancouver, Washington, ten minutes from Portland, Oregon, we’re located within an hour of world class alpine terrain and rugged Pacific coastlines. Check out this short video to learn more and see how our #Unlimiters are changing the world one protein at a time: absci.com/joinus




We are seeking Research Scientists to join our world-class Artificial Intelligence (AI) team and advance generative models for protein drug design. As a Research Scientist, you will develop advanced machine learning techniques that will be deployed for the creation of lifesaving drugs. We are looking for people who can draw on significant expertise in deep learning or related disciplines such as natural language processing, protein design, and computer vision, to develop innovative models that can learn from and generate new proteins. This position can be Remote, Hybrid or Onsite in Vancouver, WA, New York, New York or Belgrade, Serbia.




Example responsibilities

Design, implement and evaluate cutting-edge generative models for protein design
Effectively report and communicate research findings to AI and wet-lab teams across the company
Develop sampling techniques for designing diverse proteins
Collaborate with data scientists and wet-lab biologists on the design and integration of wet-lab experiments
Deploy large-scale distributed training systems on our in-house A100-based supercomputer




Qualifications

PhD in Machine Learning or equivalent practical experience
Publications at major machine learning conferences & scientific journals, or extensive experience creating deep learning models in industry
Strong Python programming skills, including with Numpy, Scipy, and Pandas, with emphasis on data science and machine learning applications.
Experience designing and training complex deep learning models in PyTorch or related platforms

This job is provided by Shine.com

Chris and David started Penny AI in 2018 in Squamish, BC (a bit north of Vancouver) after seeing an opportunity to solve a massive problem for millions of direct sales consultants around the world. We have now grown to a team of 90+ located across Canada and the United States. Penny has tens of thousands of users across four continents who trust Penny to help run their businesses.

Penny is on an upward trajectory with backing from top-tier Venture Capitalists in New York, San Francisco, Boston, Toronto and Vancouver. As we grow our team, we don’t expect everyone to know every answer. You may build something that fails spectacularly, and that’s ok. What is important is that you remain humble, you laugh a little, you learn, and together we find a way to succeed.

Diversity, inclusion and belonging are one of our core values and as we expand we are committed to finding talented people from a wide range of backgrounds, experiences and perspectives.

Learn about our hiring process here.

The Role

Penny AI is looking to add an exceptional individual to our Customer Success team in Vancouver, BC. If you have a history of providing great customer service and support, the ability to communicate effectively, and are known for your troubleshooting skills, keep reading. You will be responsible for providing high-quality customer care and tech support to a steady stream of Penny customers around the world, building and sustaining relationships, and tracking user feedback. If you’re friendly and fun, quick and efficient, we would like to hear from you!

Responsibilities

Respond to customer queries in a timely and accurate way via chat, email or phone
Identify customer needs and help customers use specific product features and guide them through the functionality and how-to-use Penny App
Troubleshoot software and hardware issues for end-users and analyze and report product malfunctions
Share feature requests and effective workarounds with team members
Assist in training junior Customer Success Representatives
Handle customer complaints, provide appropriate solutions and alternatives within the time limits
Follow communication procedures, guidelines and policies
Take the extra mile to engage customers
Take ownership of customers issues and follow problems through to resolution
Keep accurate records and document customer service actions and discussions
Maintain an orderly workflow according to priorities
Cleverly communicate in writing within tight constraints, while driving an awesome, wow-ing experience for our users
Pass on issues to senior customer success representatives when needed


About You

You love working with people in helping them succeed with their brand new Sales Assistant (Penny!)
You have rare people skills which allow you to get out in front of problems and proactively help users with potential troubles
You are patient, empathetic, and understanding, especially when the end-user is misinformed or confused about something tech-related
You’re competent with computers, have great typing skills, and can communicate clearly and effectively online
You are curious and driven by the success of others
You enjoy the opportunity to educate and train end-users
You love to communicate in writing, are obsessive about the details, and do all this with a big smile on your face!


Requirements

Experience as a Customer Support Specialist or similar CS role
Ability to work on weekends and flexible shifts
Familiarity with our industry is a plus
Experience using help desk software and remote support tools
Understanding of how CRM systems work
Ability to work on weekends and evening shifts
Excellent communication, presentation & problem-solving skills
Multi-tasking abilities
Patience when handling tough cases
Track record of over-achieving quota
Customer orientation and ability to adapt/respond to different types of users
High school diploma


Benefits

Competitive pay and a slice of the pie (aka - stock options)
4 weeks of paid vacation plus statutory holidays, and your birthday off!
Start-up culture with an opportunity to make an impact in your role and our team immediately
Excellent on-the-job learning opportunities to grow your skills

GRSP Account (or 401K in US)
Extended Healthcare Plan

Join a friendly, progressive team who like to organize fun activities and celebrate all-round awesomeness!


Diversity, Inclusion and Accessibility

We’re building an inclusive remote-first company, where no one feels like an outsider and everyone can find belonging. A work in progress? 100%. Worth it? 100%. So, you know, without a doubt, all applications are considered no matter your race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, national origin, disability, or age. And if you’re invited for an interview, please let us know if you need any accommodations or support to make the recruitment process work for you. If this makes you go, YES — then come build belonging with us!

About Us

We are an AI-Powered CX Cloud that enables enterprises to transform customer experience and boost revenue with our APIs by automating and analyzing customer interactions at scale. We assist across multiple voices and non-voice channels in 30+ languages whilst coaching and training agents with minimal costs.

The problem we are solving

In comparison to worldwide norms, customer support in traditional contact centers is quite appalling, due to a high number of queries, insufficient capacity of agents and inane customer support systems, businesses struggle with a multi-fold rise in customer discontent and bounce rate, resulting in connectivity failure points between them and customers. To address this issue, IITian couple Manish and Rashi Gupta founded Rezo's AI-Powered CX Cloud for Enterprises 2018 to help businesses avoid customer churn and boost revenue without incurring financial costs by providing 24x7 real-time responses to customer inquiries with minimal human interaction

Roles And Responsibilities

Speech Recognition model development across multiple languages.

Implement and deliver PoC's /UATs products on the Rezo platform.
Responsible for product performance, robustness and reliability.

Experience in machine learning platforms such as TensorFlow, and Pytorch and solid programming development skills (Python, C, C++ etc).
Ability to learn new tools, languages and frameworks quickly.
Familiarity with databases, data transformation techniques, and ability to work with unstructured data like OCR/ speech/text data.
Previous experience with working in Conversational AI is a plus.
Git portfolios will be helpful.

Life at Rezo.AI

We take transparency very seriously. Along with a full view of team goals, get a top-level view across the board with our regular town hall meetings.
A highly inclusive work culture that promotes a relaxed, creative, and productive environment.
Practice autonomy, open communication, and growth opportunities, while maintaining a perfect work-life balance.

Get the best in class medical insurance, programs for taking care of your mental health, and a Contemporary Leave Policy (beyond sick leaves)

Why Us?

Job_Description:
2022-75205

Asurion Data Science Internship - ML

Nashville, TN

Asurion’s Data Science internship program is a 12-week paid internship to help masters-level and PhD students get a sneak peek into product, technology and analytics. Assigned to a team, interns will have their own projects to complete and present to leadership at the end of the summer. The program will provide the intern with a unique strategic perspective, professional and personal development along the way, and experiences to enhance their academic learnings. Our goal is to allow for the intern to make contributions throughout the summer through project work, presentations, and networking. Are you ready to join our award-winning virtual internship?

Why Interns Choose and Stay with Asurion


Paid internship
In-person in Nashville TN, our global HQ
Intern to Full-Time emphasis
Diversity and Inclusion initiatives are top rated – there’s a place for everyone at Asurion!
Unlimited paid-time-off upon starting full-time employment with Asurion Full-Time


Asurion’s Internship:


Open to Masters-level and PhD students pursuing a degree related to internship duties or major below
Duration of virtual internship is 12 weeks from May 22ndto August 11th 2023
Exposure to senior leadership including but not limited to onboarding, learning and development sessions, and team business case presentations
Build an intern community through peer intern groups, mentors, direct intern leaders, senior leadership throughout the summer


The Team

This is an awesome opportunity to work hands on with a team of high performing Data Scientists focused on building data-driven products for millions of customers. Your internship with the Data Science team will be a deep dive into real-world data and sophisticated Machine Learning models. You will be given the opportunity to help out with all areas of the development process from ideation, research, experimentation, and scaling your solutions. As a member of our team, you will not just observe, but be an active participant in knowledge sharing sessions, brainstorming, workshops and design sprints as well as daily standups, retrospectives, & team outings. We are looking for an intern who is curious, humble and eager to learn – which is the way we all approach the work we do.

Responsibilities:


Gather and analyze large volumes of data, evaluate scenarios to make predictions on future outcomes and supports decision making
Design and drive the creation of new data products and analytical capabilities embedded in multiple business applications
Design large scale models using Logistic Regression, Decision Trees, Conjoint Analysis, Spatial models, Time-series models, and Machine Learning algorithms.
Analyze and interpret the results of product experiments.
Drive the collection of new data and the refinement of existing data.
Utilize Natural Language Processing to analyze speech and social data.
Interpret problems and provide solutions using appropriate data modeling techniques
Develop prototypes for new data product ideas using Machine Learning, Deep Learning & AI.
Communicate findings to product managers and development groups.


Preferred Majors: Master’s Degree in Data Science, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Advanced Analytics, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Psychology or related quantitative field, or related field, with a graduation date between May 2023 – May 2024

Requirements:
0+ years’ experience in machine learning, advanced predictive modeling, and complex data analysis
Ability to simplify and turn complex business problems into mathematical models
Ability to create low & hi-fidelity usable prototypes
Experience with analysis tools & ability to gain proficiency with new tools quickly, such as SQL, RStudio, PyCharm, Jupyter, Anaconda, VSCode, etc.
Familiar with (or able to learn quickly on the job) Amazon Web Services, such as S3, EC2, Lambda, API Gateway, Elastic BeanStalk, SageMaker.
Excellent relationship management, verbal & written communication skills
A strong passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data.
Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner.

Preferences


Interest in and/or experience in NLP (Natural Language Processing) or Time Series Analysis

Who We Are




PathAI is on a mission to improve patient outcomes with AI-powered pathology. We are transforming traditional pathology methods into powerful, new technologies. These innovations in pathology can help accelerate drug development, improve confidence in the accuracy of diagnosis, and get life-saving therapies to patients more quickly. At PathAI, you'll work with a diverse and talented team of people, who are dedicated to solving complex problems and making a huge impact.




Where You Fit




We're looking for a skilled Biomedical Data Manager to join our team and help support the execution of PathAI’s pharmaceutical and academic partnerships, including analysis of large clinical trials and validation of newly developed biomarkers and internal initiatives. The data manager will work closely with machine learning engineers, biostatisticians and program managers to ensure that our clinical datasets are well organized, accurate, and that we are maximizing our platform’s capabilities. The Data Manager will be responsible for interfacing with partners to integrate new projects, take initiative in improving our platform, and provide expertise towards the development of our system for hosting multi-modal clinical data




What You’ll Do




Lead in the assessment, development, and tuning of existing protocols for collecting and serving biomedical data to the machine learning and scientific program teams
Enable collaborations with partners in industry and academia by facilitating clinical data sharing and communication of requirements
In collaboration with the machine learning product development team, develop methods to migrate existing clinical data to new software standards and facilitate connection with our APIs.
Communicate data model to machine learning engineers, bioinformaticians, program managers and pathologists to support our interdisciplinary teams
Lead in management, inventory and organization of biomedical data, including collaborating with external vendors for data acquisition.
Lead in management, organization and digitization of physical histology slides, including the operation of digital whole slide scanning equipment.




What You Bring




Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in biomedical field (biomedical informatics, public health, epidemiology, biostatistics)
2+ years working in biomedical research with an emphasis on data curation and communication.
Familiarity with programming languages such as R AND Python for data analysis and reproducible research practices.
Strong organizational skills with meticulous attention to detail.
Prior experience combining clinical datasets from multiple trials across institutions.
Ability to work independently, communicate broadly, and take initiative
Preferred: familiarity in medical terminology (oncology and pathology), clinical trial structure, working with sensitive data sets




We Want To Hear From You




At PathAI, we are looking for individuals who are team players, are willing to do the work no matter how big or small it may be, and who are passionate about everything they do. If this sounds like you, even if you may not match the job description to a tee, we encourage you to apply. You could be exactly what we're looking for.

We don't tolerate any kind of discrimination or bias, and we are looking for teammates who feel the same way.

Deep Learning/機械学習/統計解析を中心とした先端技術を、適切にビジネス・社会に活かすことにより新たなソーシャル・インパクトを創出することを重視している会社です。




クライアントは大企業、中小企業関わらず、課題の技術的先進性と、解決することによるビジネスインパクトと社会的意義の観点から、取り組む価値が高いプロジェクトに集中しています。




機械学習・ディープラーニング技術を実際に役に立つソリューションとして提案したい人、最新の論文を研究・実装したい人、研究と実務を両立したい人、様々なジャンルのプロフェッショナルの同士でのディスカッションを楽しめる方をお待ちしております。




【会社特徴やお仕事の魅力】




・「先端技術、特にディープラーニング・機械学習技術を用いて、企業が抱える課題を解決するための最適なソリューションを提案し、社会にポジティブなインパクトを与える」ことを目的とした会社です。




・マイクロソフトやNVIDIAと提携し、Deep Learning Labの幹事企業として数千人規模のコミュニティの運営や、NVIDIA Inception partnerとしてGTC Japanなどで講演するなど、技術を正しく伝える活動にも取り組んでいます。




【お仕事の内容】




・クライアントが抱える課題に対して、統計的・機械学習的手法によるソリューションを調査研究及び考案し、実装する

・アーキテクトと一体になってプロジェクトを推進する




【必須要件】




・ディープラーニングに限らない、統計的手法や機械学習手法全般の基礎的な知識




・ライブラリやOSSを用いて機械学習手法を実装できる能力




－ 使用ライブラリは不問、公開されているプログラムを用いずに




自力で一から手法を実装できる能力があれば尚可

－ 技術的な語彙を含めた日常会話レベルの英語スピーキング能力があれば尚可




・難解な機械学習手法を平易に説明できる能力




【求める人物像】




・「ビジネスと最先端技術の最高のバランスを追求する」という、会社の想いに共感できる方




・クライアントの期待を満たし、超えるために、当事者意識を持って、自分で考え、行動し続けられる方




・不確定要素とプレッシャーのある環境下でリーダーシップやチームワークを発揮できる方




・エンジニアリングバックグラウンドを持つメンバーと積極的にコミュニケーションできる方




・ディープラーニングをはじめとした最新技術のトレンドをキャッチアップし続けられる方

Job_Description:
As Google Cloud's premier partner in AI, we provide world-class businesses with cutting-edge data solutions in the cloud. We help clients take pioneering technology to the limits by combining our expertise in machine learning, data engineering, and analytics. With Google Cloud Platform as our foundation, we help businesses future-proof their solutions, deepen their understanding of consumers, increase competitive advantage and unlock operational efficiencies.

We are currently in the process of building a world-class Strategy and Engagement team. This team will draw out and advise on the strategic interests of a fast-growing company, as well as oversee the development and implementation of data science, data analytics and data engineering projects to achieve tangible business impact.

THE ROLE

As Senior AI & MLOps Consultant, you will work with team members of Strategy & Engagement to land, manage and expand AI engagements across industries. You will dedicate efforts to fully grasp the business needs and market trends, translate these findings into a solution and approach, and work with and within technical teams to deliver.

Your responsibilities will include:

Work within the Strategy & Engagement team and collaborate with our Data Scientists, ML Engineers and MLOps Engineers to ensure client engagements capture full business value
Lead technical client discussions to scope AI solutions (i.e. business and technical requirements, delivery approach, solution overview), leveraging internal technical experts as needed
Manage successful multidisciplinary technical projects (e.g. MLOps platform, AI) with a focus on technical governance and stakeholder management
Work closely with our leadership and technical teams to fulfil company strategy and technical vision
Stay at the cutting edge of technology (of your given specialisation - AI & MLOps) through hands-on project work and upskilling
Collaborate with our partners (Google, Intel, etc.) to define and execute a joint GTM and delivery plan, including setting a cadence, structuring and leading initiatives, structuring solutions and demos, etc.
Progressively influence and manage client relationships, in order to achieve buy-in of methods and results as well as foster long-term relationships


Requirements

Previous experience in consulting within a technical / data-driven environment
Previous technical work experience as ML Engineer or MLOps Engineer; familiarity with cloud technologies
Robust problem-solving as well as verbal, written and presentation skills
Entrepreneurial drive and proven leadership skills in order to collaborate and work within a multidisciplinary team
Ability to learn quickly, prioritize tasks and perform under pressure
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in STEM and/or other quantitative disciplines


Benefits

The Basics: 25 days holiday in addition to bank holidays, pension scheme (rises by an extra 1% per year of service), team bonus payable annually, tech scheme, home equipment allowance

Health & Wellbeing: Private Healthcare Insurance, Discounted Gym Membership, Cycle to Work and Tech Scheme

Learning: Datatonic encourages continuous learning at all levels with a generous conference budget, freedom to explore the latest tools and technologies as well as regular knowledge-sharing activities. You will get access to Linux Academy, Coursera, and LinkedIn Learning and a £700 Conference Budget

Career Development: A personalised development plan to ensure you hit your professional goals with a clear roadmap for progression

Impact: The opportunity to work on cutting-edge AI and ML solutions spanning multiple industries and with market-leading organisations

Innovation: Access to Datatonic LABs, our Research & Development hub. Experiment and bring forward ideas, create impactful and meaningful work in a creative and collaborative environment - even just for fun!

Office Environment: A modern office set in the innovation hub of Canary Wharf with complimentary fruit, cookies, tea/coffee throughout the day as well as a shared café and working space with panoramic views of London

Team Vibe & Social: A welcoming and friendly team plus regular monthly social events and team off-sites including Tasty Tuesdays (paid lunch) and Thirsty Thursdays (team drinks).

WORKING FOR DATATONIC

Our UK headquarters is based in a tech-centric environment in the centre of Canary Wharf. We also have offices in Stockholm, Geneva, Munich, and Barcelona, and we work with clients in many other European countries. We allow for flexible working hours and the possibility of remote work.

We’re an eclectic team with lots of different interests and personalities. We have many different roles across data science, engineering, analytics, consulting, marketing, business development, and operations. As a company, we have a strong emphasis on learning and professional development. Our core values are:

Cultivating Excellence

A hub for continuous learning, curiosity, developing ideas, testing things out - and then putting ‘excellence’ into practice.

Owning It

Working collaboratively in cross-functional teams to achieve customer delight. We love what we do and draw immense satisfaction from taking responsibility and seeing the results of our work.

Purposeful Impact

Creating positive change for our customers, using the most relevant machine learning and analytics approaches and the best technologies to meet real business needs.

Winning with Partners & Friends

Our business has been built on great partnerships and open-source collaboration. It’s one thing to be successful, but to do it in partnership with great people and other great companies is even better in our opinion.

Datatonic is committed to being an equal opportunities employer. Diversity, equity and inclusion are a key part of our values and central to our overall mission of recruiting, retaining and promoting a diverse mix of colleagues. We encourage applications from all backgrounds, abilities and communities. If you require any accommodations or adjustments to our interview process, please reach out to jobs@datatonic.com and we will do our best to assist you.

Job_Description:
Job Overview




We are looking for a savvy Data Engineer to join our growing team of analytics experts. The hire will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up. The Data Engineer will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects. They must be self-directed and comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems and products. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of optimizing or even re-designing our company’s data architecture to support our next generation of products and data initiatives.




Skillsets




We are looking for a candidate with 2 + years of experience in a Data Engineer role, who has attained a Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field. They should also have experience using the following software/tools:




Experience in building data acquisition pipeline using Azure technologies (Azure functions, Data Factory etc.)
Fluent in Python, PySpark and building Databricks pipelines
Fluent in Databricks SQL and MS SQL
Experience in building ETL pipeline according to industry best practices
Power BI experience is a plus




This is a 6 months contract position with possible extension

Your mission

You made my day - with our innovative and market-changing platform, we are already giving a large number of people around the world access to a new, flexible and self-determined working world, while at the same time offering our customers a completely virtual and market-revolutionizing customer service through our proprietary platform.

To pursue our further growth, we are looking for you as a (Senior) AI Engineer (m/w/d) to design new and develop existing AI applications. We offer you a founder-led, economically successful and strongly growing startup with an open and fun culture. And the treasure of our self-developed, state of the art communication platform and a vast range of available data and challenging AI use cases. According to our work philosophy, you can work from home or from any of our cool offices in Berlin, Munich, Halle or Sofia/Bulgaria.

Your Mission

Curiosity to identify applications for state-of-the-art machine learning models (e.g. in the fields of speech or NLP, optimization)
Development and testing of AI prototypes as part of one of our cross-functional product teams (product & UI, frontend and backend development)
Exchange with customers on requirements for AI applications together with the product team
Conception and implementation of AI architecture principles and ML pipelines


Your profile

Degree in computer science, mathematics, physics or engineering
At least 2 years of experience in machine learning projects
Experience writing modern Python code using ML frameworks and data processing libraries (e.g. PyTorch, Tensorflow, scikit-learn, pandas, numpy, …)
Good communication skills in English or German
Eagerness to learn new things


Why us?

Task: You create your own area of responsibility and expand it through short decision-making processes and a lot of creative freedom
Innovation: An exciting field that wants to develop in a performance-oriented and motivated team and through the latest technologies
Footprint: You will work with us on the three global trends Future of Work, Sustainability and Sharing Economy
Values: We see ourselves as a loyal start-up family, in which we will develop together with authenticity as well as couarge and therefore, sustainably change the world for a better with every step
Work-Life-Balance: Work wherever you want within a flexible time frame - because it is the results that count__

Description

As Huawei Turkey R&D Center, we are now looking for Research Engineers to join our ranks. We, as the Turkey AI Team of the Petal Search, are mainly working on search results improvement to increase end-user satisfaction. In order to improve search results, we are applying/customizing state-of-the-art approaches in the fields of Natural Language Processing, Information Retrieval, Machine Learning and Deep Learning. In our team, we are trying to allocate time for research and development as well as publishing papers in top conferences such as ACL, EMNLP, SIGIR, CIKM.




What we are expecting:

· Design and build scalable ML models

· Deploy ML models to production at scale considering resource constraints

· Monitoring models to evaluate and improve

· Play an active role in suggesting, collecting, and preprocessing the data necessary to train the ML models and evaluate performance

· Consult with the other teams to determine the requirements and formalize the possible ML research directions

· Following the state-of-the-art NLP models in the literature

· Transforming new research ideas into publication at top conferences




Essential technical requirements:

A. Basic computer science and programming languages

· Understanding of data structures, data modelling, and software architecture

· Having expertise in object-oriented programming

· Ability to write reusable and easily-maintainable code using beautiful and proper design patterns,

· Ability to write robust and optimized code in Python

· Ability to use a code versioning system like Git/SVN

· Hands-on experience in Hadoop, HDFS, Spark, SparkNLP

B. Machine/Deep Learning

· Solid understanding of Neural Network architectures

· Familiarity with modern machine / deep learning frameworks (such as Pytorch, Pytorch-Lightning, Tensorflow, Keras, Huggingface Transformers, LightGBM, XGBoost, Sklearn)

· Proven experience as a Machine Learning/AI Engineer or similar role

· Practical experience in deploying and optimizing ML models in production

· Experience in NLP tasks

C. Academic

· PhD in Computer Engineering or related fields, include in the fields of Natural Language Processing, Information Retrieval, Machine Learning and Deep Learning

· MSc is also acceptable with at least 5 years work experience in NLP/ML/DL domains

· Solid knowledge and hands-on experience in one of the research fields mentioned above

D. Essential non-technical requirements:

Native Arabic or fluent in Arabic language (Highly recommended but not necessary)
Fluent in English, both written and spoken
Ability to work in a multi-disciplinary and multi-cultural team




You will be a member of Turkey Petal Search AI team which:

· applies research capabilities to large scale live search engine product

· gains applied research experience everyday

· improves end-user experiences for Petal Search engine

· has experienced team members on NLP/DL/ML domains from top universities

· offers a great opportunity to improve academic background with talks, seminars, training's etc.

· has supportive, respectful, dynamic, and amusing team spirit

· communicates overseas teams and collaborates regularly




Do you recognise yourself in the job profile? Then we look forward to receiving your application!

Misschien ben je al eens gaan wandelen op een zondagnamiddag langs het water terwijl een boot naast je doorvoer. In eerste instantie niet iets wat speciaal lijkt, maar na het lezen van deze vacature kijk je er misschien anders naar. Want mogelijks wist je niet dat tal van deze boten vanaf het land worden bestuurd. Om dit mogelijk te maken, is er natuurlijk nood aan technische krakken die dit mogelijk kunnen maken. En wie weet ben jij dat wel!




Jobomschrijving




Voordat we een schip technisch helemaal in staat kunnen maken om van op afstand te laten besturen, is er eerst nood aan een hele analyse. Hoewel dit niet tot jouw core taken behoort, word je hier zeker bij betrokken. Verder maak je deel uit van het R&D team die de software achter de controllers maakt. Om dit mogelijk te maken wordt er gebruik gemaakt van algoritmes waar jij de hand aan legt. Daarnaast bekijk je ook de mogelijkheden voor onze partners en werk je mee aan Europese projecten.




Profiel




De juiste motivatie en een start-up mentaliteit is van ongelooflijk belang
Je bezit over een Bachelor of Master in Engineering/ Informatica/ Wiskunde/ Fysica/
Je hebt minstens 2 jaar ervaring
Kennis van DevOps is een plus
C++ en Python kennen ondertussen geen verrassingen meer voor jou
Een corporate werkstijl past absoluut Niet bij jou. Jij vaart mee met de flow en kan letterlijk en figuurlijk snel schakelen
Fluent in English. French or Dutch is an advantage
Je bent een vlotte communicator en bent nauwkeurig in het bewaren van documentatie




Aanbod




Een uitdagende functie in een bedrijf met een sterk groeipotentieel en ook de ambitie om dit potentieel te bereiken. Hierbij horen natuurlijk ook mogelijkheden voor jou.
Je zal werken aan producten die de toekomst van de scheepsvaart industrie zullen vormen waardoor je veel voldoening zal krijgen. Want ook het ecologisch aspect is hier enorm belangrijk.
Binnen dit bedrijf zal je een hardwerkend team terugvinden dat trots is op wat zij doen. Dit zorgt voor een gedreven maar ook leuke werksfeer.
Het bedrijf is gelegen op een worp van leuke cafés en restaurants om de nodige stoom af te kunnen blazen na een goede werkdag of week.
Voor je harde inzet en werk krijg je natuurlijk een bijhorende verloning dat bestaat uit een brutoloon met een interessant voordelenpakket (inclusief bedrijfswagen) en doorgroeimogelijkheden.

Aarzel dan zeker niet om ons samen met je CV te contacteren via onderstaande knop.




We zorgen steeds voor een confidentiële behandeling van je kandidatuur.

Whom you'll work with

We from ANTICIPATE are an international team of tech enthusiasts ready to bring AI solutions to the manufacturing industry. We develop a web application to automate the implementation process of AI-powered machine vision solutions and implement our own AI solutions in different industries. Our efforts go back to 2019 when we started to develop our first MVP in collaboration with the Digital Capability Center Aachen (DCC Aachen) and RWTH Aachen University. Since then, we validated the product in various industries and developed it into a fully comprehensive and end-to-end solution.

We are looking for our location in Aachen or remote continuously, for a candidate with the following qualifications:

3+ years of industry experience working on projects such as: real-time object and body tracking and pose estimation, and/or image processing.

Excellent modern Python programming skills.

What you’ll do

You will work with us on our software stack for industrial environments and improve the user experience of our product.

Design and develop novel computer vision and/or machine learning algorithms in areas such as: real-time scene and object tracking, body tracking, human pose estimation and much more
Prepare yourself to lead a team of software engineers
Work in a multidisciplinary team with other professionals such as back-end developers, DevOps engineers and others.
Take part in the research and proofs-of-concept of new technologies. Present findings to our leadership




Benefits

The possibility to gather industry experience by working on highly relevant topics, with a lot of space for autonomy in your tasks.

Startup atmosphere with a very friendly way of working – we are looking for a colleague to finish the day with after-work activities from time to time
Challenging and diverse tasks and the opportunity to learn quickly
A strong environment of bright colleagues, top management consulting, international tech partners, and close cooperation with our customers
A competitive salary, based on a fixed compensation and a virtual stock option program
Your work-life balance is important to us, thus we support your activity with an urban sports club membership.
A permanent full-time position with 30 days of annual paid vacation (in Germany)

 

Interested? We would like to get to know you as soon as possible. Simply send your documents (CV + GitHub Account + if you think something else is important) to info@anticipate.ml, and we will get in touch with you!

Who We Are




We started Clinc in 2015 with the mission to use the best advancements in academic research, science and technology to create a meaningful and tangible impact on the world. Since then, we have seen exponential growth delivering cutting-edge technology at global scale, and empowering people to lead more enjoyable lives with conversational AI. We are a passionate group of change-makers inspired by the world’s most difficult challenges and a gritty resolve to take them on. If you want to influence the future of AI and make our world a better place to live, join us.




Job Overview




We are looking for software engineers experience in natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning (ML) to join the research-focused Core AI team of Clinc. Members of the Core AI team are expected to not only understand, wield, and build on top of our conversational system, but also to be able to conduct high-impact research to push the limits of our conversational capabilities. All of our research projects stem from problems encountered during real-life use cases, and have a direct impact on the company’s product, as well as the end customer’s experience. As a member of the Core AI team, you will also have opportunities to publish findings in top-tier peer-reviewed NLP venues.




The ideal candidate will have experience in various facets of NLP, such as classification, dialogue management, slot-filling, information extraction, clustering, etc. The ideal candidate would be able to provide individual contributions by solving research problems with innovative yet practical solutions that would work in real-world use cases. The ideal candidate has a strong interest in publishing academic research papers in the top tier conferences, such as ACL, EMNLP, and SIGDIAL.




Responsibilities for Core AI Software Engineer




Execute and deliver research projects and ML technologies that add value to our state of the art conversational platform
Publish our findings in top-tier academic research conferences and journals
Implement and evaluate techniques in production quality for eventual transfer to our product


Minimum Qualifications for Core AI Software Engineer




Master’s or bachelor’s degree in Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field of study
2+ years of experience working in conversational systems or a field related to natural language processing
Ability to formulate meaningful experiments to prove the value of potential solutions to various problems
Strong foundation in mathematics and statistics
Strong programming skills in a high-level programming language (C, Python), along with commonly used ML frameworks/libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch, NumPy, SciPy, etc.)
A passion to deliver innovative yet practical solutions with real-world impacts
A passion to learn and grow


Preferred Qualifications for Core AI Software Engineer




PhD in Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field of study
Academic publication history
Experience with any of the following topics:
* Text Classification
* Slot-Filling Models
* Conversational Dialog Systems
* Information Retrieval
* Relation Extraction
* QA Systems
* Language Modeling
* Language Generation


Culture, Diversity and Inclusivity




Clinc has a proven commitment to diversity and inclusion. We strive to create an environment in which all people are equally respected and valued, irrespective of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, ethnicity, age, religion, citizenship or any other characteristic.

At SixSense, you will lead the AI team and own the ideation and development of the next generation of AI algorithms and tools. You will work on cutting-edge technologies and the latest advances in deep learning and computer vision and build a game-changing platform for the future of deep learning for images.




Responsibilities




Design the company's AI roadmap and oversee its implementation.
Lead POCs and full-scale deployments for enterprise customers.

Job_Description:
Description-




Building from the success of the Sepsis initiative thus far, Danaher Diagnostics is creating a data analytics and science team to generate novel insights and real world evidence (RWE) from real world data (RWD) that contain lab results generated by DHR Dx OpCo instruments linked to patient medical records. In this role, you will be responsible for driving technical execution and and helping us create a best-in-class data & analytics organization. You will work with various stakeholders both inside and outside the organization to execute on our research initiatives. Responsibilities Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements for ML, Data Science and Analytics projects.




Assemble large, complex data sets from disparate sources, writing code, scripts, and queries, as appropriate to efficiently extract, QC, clean, harmonize and visualize Big Data sets.




Develop software tools for data engineering tasks following industry standard practices such as agile, test-driven development, and CI/CD and deliver them to internal customers.




Write pipelines for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using Python, SQL, Spark, AWS, and Azure ‘big data’ technologies.




Identify, design, and implement continuous process improvements such as automating manual processes and optimizing data delivery.




Document data processes, write data management recommended procedures, and create training materials relating to data management best practices.




Required Qualifications




Expertise in Python with strong knowledge of Python best practices, particularly as they apply to the area of data & analytics, and experience using standard data science toolkits




Previous experience performing data engineering tasks on RWD/RWE projects involving Electronic Medical Records (EMR) data




Experience with defining clinical protocols to collect RWD




Advanced SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.




Familiarity with healthcare data standards, data ontologies, toolchains, and operating procedures An associate who is independent, self-motivated, and eager to excel in a goal-oriented and multi-faceted work environment




Someone who embraces uncertainty and thrives by driving to clarity in a fast-paced ambiguous environment




Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to clearly articulate project goals, timelines, and key milestones, and accomplishments to stakeholders.




Desired Qualifications




Experience with digital health, AI/ML algorithms, Clinical Decision Support (CDS) products




Experience with developing software solutions on public cloud infrastructures, particularly Amazon AWS and Microsoft Azure




Knowledge of security and privacy requirements and certifications, including HIPAA, GDPR, ISO9001, ISO27001




Experience with a variety of standard Python data visualization methods




Knowledge of cluster computing and large-scale data analytics platforms such as Apache Spark




Knowledge of shared data science development and analytics environments such as JupyterLab.




Education: Bachelors Degree

Upstage AI Research Engineer(AIRE) 는 고객이 직면한 과제를 이해하고 AI기술로 고객의 과제를 해결할 수 있는 방법에 대하여 생각합니다.




AI에 대한 지식을 바탕으로 문제를 정의하고 최신 AI모델의 프로토타입을 만들고 개선을 위한 추가 요구사항들을 분석합니다.




개발한 AI모델을 실제 프로덕션으로 제공 및 적용하는데 존재하는 기술적 한계를 돌파합니다.




Upstage AIRE는 Making AI beneficial이라는 미션을 달성하기 위하여 현실에 존재하는 기술적 및 이론적 한계를 뛰어넘는 차세대 AI기술 개발을 수행합니다.




제안된 AI모델은 추가적인 엔지니어링 검증을 통해 실제 프로덕션 환경에 배포될 수 있으며, 연구활동을 통한 결과물은 국제 학회에 출간될 수 있습니다.




Upstage AIRE 는 성공적인 AI 시스템 구축을 위해 Data Scientist, Data Manager, Software Engineer, Project manager 등의 타직군과도 긴밀하게 협업합니다.




또한 Upstage 문화와 미션을 함께 설계하며 다양한 아이디어를 구상하고 실현할 수 있기를 기대합니다.




※ 관심 직무는 ML Researcher와 ML Engineer로 나누어져 있지만, 모집 및 선발 전형은 별도 구분 없이 공통으로 진행 예정입니다.




주요 업무




최신(state-of-the-art) 모델의 프로토타입핑
프로덕션 시스템에서 실행할 수 있도록 모델 최적화
모델 성능에 대한 객관적인 메트릭 정의 및 측정
제품 요구 사항을 이해하고 이를 개발 목표 및 작업으로 변환
신규 기능의 모델 개발을 위한 데이터 수집 및 라벨링 방법 설계
고객의 문제를 가장 효율적으로 해결하는 방법에 대해 논의
문제 해결을 위한 가설 제시 및 검증을 수행
CV, NLP, RecSys 등의 특정 도메인에서의 AI 기술 개발




모집 분야:




Computer Vision
Recommender Systems
Natural Language Processing




근무 형태:




정규직 (전문연구요원 전직 대상)




근무지:




광교 오피스 (상현역 근처 도보 10분)

Job_Title: Lead AI (NLP) / Head of AI (NLP) for a Legal Tech Startup
Job_Description:
Description




Are you passionate about using AI to solve challenging problems and drive innovation? Do you thrive in a dynamic and interdisciplinary environment? Legartis is looking for a Lead AI / Head of AI to lead the development and implementation of AI solutions that are transforming the legal industry. In this role, you will work closely with the CTO to align AI initiatives with the company's overall goals and objectives.




We are Legartis, a leading LegalTech startup that is revolutionising contract reviewing with the help of AI with our SaaS product. Our talented, diverse team consists of over 35 people with backgrounds in product, software development, legal-engineering, machine learning, data science, marketing and sales.




Your mission




Develop and implement the long-term strategy for the use of AI in our product together with the product team
Build and develop the AI architecture that is scalable and API-centric
Evaluate and select appropriate AI technologies and platforms
Develop and architect solutions in text classification, document clustering, document zoning and segmentation, named entity recognition, search, information retrieval, and relation extraction
As a leader in AI, you will provide guidance and coach team members to ensure that they adhere to best practices in the AI space
Conduct research and stay up-to-date on the latest developments and innovations in the field of AI
Work with external partners and vendors to incorporate AI technologies and tools into the company's products and services
Monitor and analyze the performance of our AI, and make adjustments as needed


Your profile




Proven track record in AI research and development with a focus on Natural Language Processing (NLP)
Strong understanding of machine learning, NLP, and other AI technologies
Experience with selecting and applying ML & NLP algorithms to build systems that learn from structured and unstructured data
Hands-on: Proficient scientific programmer, experience in Python (especially scikit-learn), and fluent in statistics and algorithms
Ability to think strategically and provide direction and guidance to the AI team
Fluency in English is required, German is a plus
Entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to identify opportunities and take initiative
Plus: Experience with tools in (web-based) text annotation
Plus: Experience with NLP for the German language
Plus: Contributor to software products or research where ML & NLP played a major role, actively following latest ML & NLP trends
Tech stack: Python, django, pytorch, pandas, sklearn
Nice to have: typescript, Haskell, MLFlow, model analytics (captum, wandb)


Why us?




Opportunity to lead the development and implementation of cutting-edge AI solutions
Work with a talented and dedicated team of researchers and engineers
Shape an industry: Legal tech is still at an early stage. Together with Legartis you can shape an entire new industry
Competitive, fixed salary
Employee stock ownership plan (ESOP) that allows employees to have a share in the success of the company
5 weeks of holidays with the possibility to take two weeks unpaid leave
Great opportunities to make an impact and grow professionally
Centrally located office in the heart of Zurich
Hybrid work model
Regular team events such as apéros, lunches, restaurant testing or hikes


Process




Mutual respect and transparency are two core values of Legartis which shall shine through the whole hiring process.




We will review your CV to get an overview of your experience, skills, and qualifications.
We will have a 15-minute call where we can discuss your background and get to know each other better. This will also be an opportunity for you to ask any questions you may have about the company or the role.
Next, you will have an in-depth interview with our CTO and Product Manager Data. This will be an opportunity for you to showcase your technical skills and experience, as well as learn more about our company and your role
After the interview, you will participate in a technical challenge. This could be a coding exercise or a case study, and will give us a chance to assess your technical abilities in a more hands-on way.
Finally, you will have the opportunity to meet the team and get to know everyone you would be working with. This will be a chance for you to ask any remaining questions and get a sense of our company culture.


We are Legartis, a LegalTech startup that changes the way contracts are analyzed today. Our SaaS solution uses AI to review contracts, just like a professional does, but a lot faster. We are a growing and ambitious team determined to eliminate repetitive work from the lives of our users. Since our incorporation in 2017, we have won various awards such as the Swiss Fintech Awards, were listed as a Top100 startup in Switzerland or named by Forbes as one of the best AI startups in the DACH region.

업스테이지는 세계 최고 수준의 AI 모델과 그 모델을 지속적으로 관리, 개선, 운영하기 위한 데이터, 학습, 서빙과 관련된 모든 필수 소프트웨어를 하나로 묶은 “AI 팩”을 개발하고 있으며, 세상에 없던 AI 솔루션을 통해 Making AI Beneficial이라는 미션을 향해 나아갑니다.




제품 및 서비스 출시를 앞두고, AI Biz Development 는 업스테이지 사업 개발과 제품 및 서비스 도입을 희망하는 고객사와의 비즈니스 커뮤니케이션을 담당합니다. 그리고 고객사의 니즈와 이슈를 정확히 파악 후 그를 해결할 수 있는 솔루션을 제공하는 업무를 수행합니다.




주요 업무:




파트너쉽 개발, 사업영역 검토 개발 등을 포함한 사업 개발 관련 업무 수행
업스테이지의 제품 및 서비스 도입 희망하는 잠재고객사와의 초기 커뮤니케이션 수행
잠재고객사의 현황 및 이슈, 개선 목표 파악
잠재고객사와 자사 내부 유관팀 사이에서 명확한 커뮤니케이션 중재
잠재고객사가 희망하는 요청 사항 검토 및 수행 (e.g., 보고, PT, 이슈핸들링)
제품 및 서비스 도입 후 고객사 비즈니스 관점에서 발생하는 이슈 및 개선 포인트 청취 및 내부 전달




모집 분야:




AI Biz Development (사업개발)




근무 형태:




정규직
리모트워크 - 리모트워크를 위한 업무장비/환경 지원
필요시 고객사 방문/ 출장




모집절차




서류 전형
1차 롤매칭 인터뷰 (가능하면 오프라인으로 진행)
2차 롤매칭 인터뷰
컬쳐 인터뷰
성킴(CEO) 인터뷰
최종 결과 발표
절차는 상황에 따라 조정될 수 있습니다.
성킴 인터뷰 후, 레퍼런스 체크 절차가 진행될 수 있습니다.

SentiOne is an AI-powered social listening and omnichannel customer service automation platform, powered with industry-agnostic NLU engine. We provide cutting-edge AI technology for automating customer service across multiple channels combined with powerful social listening and analytics for customers in more than 70 countries across the globe.




Flat structure, no micromanagement, no dress code, celebrating every possible occasion - that’s us in a nutshell :) We value culture based on innovation, transparency and open communication. As a team, we’ve created a space to develop our unique talents and exchange knowledge. We respect each other and trust each other's judgment.




What You’ll Be Responsible For




We’re looking for a Conversational AI Architect to join our growing bot design team, working on our SentiOne Automate platform.




Automate is our cutting edge bot building, NLU and analytics platform.




Our team at SentiOne owns the entire conversation design and development process, working closely with our product specialists, engineers, linguists and AI researchers in Gdańsk.




Using our platform you’ll be bringing conversational experiences to life; building and launching chat and voice bots for a range of clients.




What You’ll Be Responsible For




Diving deep into our Automate platform and building complex conversational journeys along with our bot designers and clients
Managing the architecture of our platform and conversational components over a variety of projects
Supporting our bot designers in technical aspects of the platform
Writing data processing scripts and manipulating data logic for contextual conversations using conditions, variables and strings
Assist in connecting our bots to multiple integrations and APIs
Using regular expressions, variables and other data to understand user intent and converting this to usable flows
In charge of leading the practice and introducing the overall technical vision for a particular solution
Educating our clients on how to use our platform
Driving documentation efforts when building bot flows and updating our internal wiki as well as participating in our learning workshops internally and with clients
Collaborating with our language researchers, bot developers, commercial managers and product owners
Assisting in resolving bugs and errors of our bots and platform




What You Need To Get The Job Done




Have at least 3 years experience in any of the following: RPA, AI, automation, chatbots (virtual/digital assistants) and/or building digital products
Familiar with keys, strings and variables to manipulate responses with code e.g. using JSON (converting JSON documents/files etc.)
Have a good working knowledge of JavaScript
Worked with APIs, integration and databases
A technical and problem-solving mindset - you dig deep to unravel issues and find solutions
Able to see the ‘big picture’ of a platform or development process and understand the impact of changes
Enthusiastic about chatbots, AI, NLU and machine learning
Proficiency in English




Nice To Have




Qualifications in automated testing, scripting (QA) or software development
Experience using conversation design tools for flows and prototyping e.g. Whimsical, Miro, Botmock or Botsociety
Knowledge of NLU and/or technologies such as Dialogflow, IBM Watson, Alexa conversations etc.
Experience as a developer




What Are Our Drawing Cards




CONVENIENT FORM OF EMPLOYMENT. You can choose between a contract of employment and B2B.
TRUST, OWNERSHIP, FREEDOM. We believe in people and their potential – which is why we give them space to use their knowledge and expertise. You take ownership and responsibility for your work. No micromanagement here.
OWN AI PRODUCTS. We develop our products using the latest technologies and state-of-the-art solutions in the field of intent detection and text processing. You have an impact on the products we create.
FLEXIBLE WORKING HOURS. Reasonably balanced schedule is the key to productivity. It doesn’t matter if you are an early bird or you get a lot done in the wee hours of the night. Just make sure you are available within our core hours - 10 am - 4 pm CET.
HOLIDAYS & DAYS OFF. Everyone needs to recharge their batteries and get some rest. Regardless of the contract, you get paid days off.
WORK FROM ANYWHERE. You can work from one of our offices or another location as long as you have good wi-fi and availability within our core hours. We are distributed-first but we pop into our Gdańsk or Warsaw offices from time to time. We encourage you to do so as well, it’s fun!
DEVELOPMENT & LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES. Our goal is to create tailored-made development paths for all our SentiTeam members. You can also join our SentiAcademy to learn new skills from talented peers.
SOCIALS & OFFSITES. Depending on the pandemic situation, we organise weekly lunches, beer nights with board games and offsites... And our integration events are surely the ones to remember!
HEALTH & SPORTS PERKS. Private medical care covered in 100%. Plus MultiSport card and people who like to work out. Climbing, sailing, snowboard, gym? You will always find a training partner!




Here's What Our Recruitment Process Looks Like




SentiOne is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based on race, religion, gender, age, sexuality, or physical ability. If you have any questions, feel free to contact us by LinkedIn, for an informal conversation.

Job_Title: Programa de Estágio 2023 - São Caetano do Sul
Location: São Caetano do Sul, São Paulo, Brazil
Job_Description:
Job Description

O que você acha de estagiar em uma empresa automotiva que tem como objetivo Zero acidente, Zero emissão e Zero congestionamento? Legal né?

Somos a General Motors, a maior empresa da indústria automotiva.

Estamos a quase 100 anos no Brasil com a marca Chevrolet e temos orgulho em projetar, construir e vender os melhores veículos do mundo.

Estamos à procura de uma nova geração de estagiários visionários para nos ajudar a lançar iniciativas ousadas de engenharia e de negócios, e dar forma às novas direções da companhia.

Temos o objetivo de sermos a empresa mais inclusiva do mundo e oferecemos aos estagiários a oportunidade de adquirir experiência profissional e se desenvolver como pessoa, trabalhando em um ambiente diverso, dinâmico, desafiador, cheio de inovações e que oferece autonomia na tomada de decisão para crescer. Queremos desenvolver estagiários protagonistas.

Estamos em busca de estudantes dos cursos Bacharel e Tecnólogo:

Administração de Empresas

Secretariado e muito mais!


Para o seu desenvolvimento oferecemos:

Programa I-Learn (Internship Learning Program) O objetivo principal é fortalecer as habilidades comportamentais e técnicas do nosso pool de talentos de estágio, oferecendo treinamentos e palestras mensais com um catálogo de padrão para toda a região South America;
Plataformas e ferramentas de desenvolvimento: GM Learning, Degreed, Universidade Chevrolet;
Mentoria de carreira.


Additional Job Description

Mas, e aí, o que mais você precisa para estagiar aqui conosco?

Estar regularmente matriculado e com graduação prevista entre Julho/2024 à Dezembro/2025;
Conhecimento intermediário ao avançado em inglês;
Conhecimento em pacote Office;
Power BI desejável;
Disponibilidade para estagiar 6 horas;
Capacidade de interação com diversas áreas e pessoas nos diversos níveis da companhia.


Benefícios:

Modelo de trabalho híbrido ou presencial (a depender da oportunidade)
Horário de estágio das 08h às 15h / 10h às 17h00
Ajuda de custo para transporte
Assistência Ambulatorial
Restaurante no Local

Parceria com GymPass
Vantagens GM com desconto em serviços de: Gastronomia, Vestuário, Bem-Estar e Lazer, Seguros e Educação.
